comments:
20050217
Signature.getTypeSignatureKind throws an IllegalArgumentException when a
signature for wild card is passed.
Are signatures for wild cards not considered as type signatures?

For Signature.getTypeArguments("QClass<*>;")[0], we get "*". In the syntax spec
of Signature, "*" is not a valid signature. On the other hand,
getTypeArguments(..) is spec'd to return "the signatures of the type arguments".

This is a problem when we try to render method argument types in this example:

public class Wild {
	void take(Class<?> c) { }
}

Error 2005-02-23 12:06:46.692 Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in:
"org.eclipse.jface".

Martin, I released a workaround in JavaElementLabels to prevent the exception
from comment 1.
*** Bug 86668 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

  SignatureTests#testGetTypeSignatureKind()
  SignatureTests#testGetTypeSignatureKind2()

Added new type kind Signature#WILDCARD_TYPE_SIGNATURE
